xtc.lang.cpp

Class Syntax.Conditional

  • java.lang.Object
    • xtc.tree.Node
      • xtc.tree.Token
        • xtc.lang.cpp.Syntax
          • xtc.lang.cpp.Syntax.Conditional
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Object>, Locatable
    Enclosing class:
    Syntax

    public static class Syntax.Conditional
extends Syntax
    A conditional. This class provides the internal, normalized representation of preprocessor conditional directives.

      • getTokenText

        public String getTokenText()
        Description copied from class: Node
        Treat this node as a token and get its text. This method strips away any annotations, treats the resulting node as a token, and returns its text. User-specified classes must not override this method.
        Specified by:
        getTokenText in class Token
        Returns:
        The token's text.
        See Also:
        Node.strip()

        public String toString()
        Description copied from class: Node
        Return a human readable representation of this node. The default implementation creates a new string builder, writes this node to the builder, and then returns the corresponding string. Subclasses should typically override Node.write(Appendable).
        Overrides:
